WorkItem.Description:
Hello - 

I have just updated to TypeScript 0.9.1.0 and am no longer able to use source maps and am not able to debug in chrome anymore. Is there a problem with sourcemaps, and why is chrome debugging not working anymore ?
WorkItem.Summary: Source map / debugging no longer working in chrome

Comments.Message: me too. can anyone help me?

This may be caused by the change in style of linking to the source map.  The current source map spec now uses "//#" at the bottom of JS files instead of "//@".  I'm not sure if Chrome supports the new spec, yet, but they will need to be updated.  

You can try out to see if that's the issue by manually changing the source link at the bottom of the .js file to point the old //@ style.
Hello Jon - not too sure what you mean. I had a look at the source map - and was unable to find "//@" or "//#" . Please clarify. Thank you for your prompt reply.
OK - understood - I was looking at the map file - as opposed to the JS - will try and report back.
Spelling mistake (somewhat embarrassing) - Thank you Jon.

try crome canary ( chrome 30 ) . working fine there
https://dl.google.com/tag/s/appguid%3D%7B8A69D345-D564-463C-AFF1-A69D9E530F96%7D%26iid%3D%7BF4040A1D-DCA5-8E7F-9B6E-14964ACC45F8%7D%26lang%3Den-GB%26browser%3D4%26usagestats%3D0%26appname%3DGoogle%2520Chrome%26needsadmin%3Dprefers%26installdataindex%3Ddefaultbrowser/update2/installers/ChromeSetup.exe
